intro: Cyclosorus paucipinnus, commonly known as the sparse-pinnate water clover, is a rare and delicate aquatic fern found in freshwater habitats. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, grass-like fronds that grow from a creeping rhizome. The plant typically thrives in slow-moving or still waters with muddy substrates, often in shaded environments. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are borne on the undersides of the fronds, contributing to its propagation. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in many regions.
